content: the wattle seed top kids this sweet simple top is made top down seamlessly with a round yoke and simple bobble detail included are sizes for 2-10 year olds approx indicated in the following way 2 4 6 8 10 designed to be slightly cropped with a small amount of positive ease you could size up if your intended recipient prefers a loose style and the pattern includes notes on where to add row if you prefer more length stitches used us terms foundation single_crochet fsc materials a half_double_crochet half_double_crochet 8ply/dk/#3 yarn single_crochet single_crochet 4 5mm hook 5 double_crochet together in one stitch bobble b 4mm hook optional hcd around post from back bphdc darning needle hcd around post from front fphdc measuring tape 2 half_double_crochet into one stitch increase 2hdc a 25 5 27 5 29 31 32 cm slip_stitch slip_stitch b 27 30 32 35 38 cm meterage notes 2 300m 4 350m this top is worked in rounds joining on each row and turning on each 6 400m row unless specified 8 460m 10 525m ch1 at beginning of row never counts as a stitch the seam ends up along the back of one sleeve and then down the difficulty side of the top so its least noticeable suitable for a confident pattern is written assuming your bobbles end up poking out the back of beginner the row you re working - some people work them to be poking towards you as you work them if you do the latter you will need to push your swatch bobbles through to the other side using 4 5mm hook brackets at end of row indicate stitch count at end of that row 17 stitches and 13 row of half_double_crochet = for contrasted colour detail work your contrast yarn just for the bobble 10x10cm stitches and for the one row immediately before post row be careful not to work your foundation row too tight or you may have trouble with it fitting over its recipients head if possibly try it on after a couple of row have been worked to ensure it will fit begin yoke row 1 fsc 54 60 66 72 78 join to first stitch being careful not to twist your row ch1 and turn row 2 2hdc increase *half_double_crochet 2 2hdc* repeat between * 17 19 21 23 25 times half_double_crochet in remaining 2 stitches slip_stitch into top of first stitch from row ch1 and turn 72 80 88 96 104 row 3 half_double_crochet 1 *bobble half_double_crochet 3* repeat between * 17 19 21 23 25 times bobble half_double_crochet in remaining 2 stitches slip_stitch into top of first stitch from row ch1 and turn 72 80 88 96 104 row 4 2hdc increase *half_double_crochet 3 2hdc* repeat between * 17 19 21 23 25 times half_double_crochet in remaining 3 stitches slip_stitch into top of first stitch from row ch1 and turn 90 100 110 120 130 row 5 half_double_crochet in each stitch slip_stitch into top of
